data.title: Turner by Armstrong Sir Walter
data.meta_description: Turner Volume 2 [LeatherBound] by Armstrong, Walter, Sir (1902) and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
LeatherBound. Condition: New. LeatherBound edition. Condition: New. Reprinted from 1902 edition. Leather Binding on Spine and Corners with Golden leaf printing on spine. NO changes have been made to the original text. This is NOT a retyped or an ocr'd reprint. Illustrations, Index, if any, are included in black and white. Each page is checked manually before printing. As this print on demand book is reprinted from a very old book, there could be some missing or flawed pages, but we always try to make the book as complete as possible. Fold-outs, if any, are not part of the book. If the original book was published in multiple volumes then this reprint is of only one volume, not the whole set. Sewing binding for longer life, where the book block is actually sewn (smythe sewn/section sewn) with thread before binding which results in a more durable type of binding. Pages: 321 Volume 2 Language: English.

LeatherBound. Condition: New. LeatherBound edition. Condition: New. Reprinted from 1902 edition. Leather Binding on Spine and Corners with Golden leaf printing on spine. NO changes have been made to the original text. This is NOT a retyped or an ocr'd reprint. Illustrations, Index, if any, are included in black and white. Each page is checked manually before printing. As this print on demand book is reprinted from a very old book, there could be some missing or flawed pages, but we always try to make the book as complete as possible. Fold-outs, if any, are not part of the book. If the original book was published in multiple volumes then this reprint is of only one volume, not the whole set. Sewing binding for longer life, where the book block is actually sewn (smythe sewn/section sewn) with thread before binding which results in a more durable type of binding. Pages: 365 Volume 1 Language: English.

Cloth. Condition: Very Good. J. M. W. Turner (illustrator). An uncommon limited edition of this biography of J. M. W. Turner, featuring an impressive number of his works printed on special paper. No. 670 of 1000 copies printed on special paper, in the publisher's original cloth binding. Signed by the publisher to the limitations page. Blind stamp of Neatham Mill Library to the rear free end paper. Illustrated with 103 plates including a frontispiece and a title page vignette. One plate is a facsimile of a letter written by Turner. Two plates are in colour and are tipped in: Lausanne from Le Signal and Monte Rosa from opposite Aosta. Collated complete. Sir Walter Armstrong (1850-1918) was a British art historian and author who later became Director of the National Gallery of Ireland. In this volume, he provides a biography of renowned Impressionist artist J. M. W. Turner, with numerous and exquisitely engraved plates of Turner's paintings. It also contains a list of his oil pictures and watercolour drawings. This is an uncommon work which is unusual in this smart condition. In the publisher's original cloth binding. Externally smart, with light shelf wear to the extremities and fading to the spine; there are also some faint marks to the boards. A little play to the hinges but both are holding reasonably firm. Internally, firmly bound. Pages are generally bright and clean, with a scattering of spots throughout and occasionally some soiling to the page perimeters. Very Good. book.

Hardbound. Brown/burgundy cloth boards, [x] 292 pp, 103 bw illustrations, each with a protective thin paper sheaf bound in. Oversize. Weighs 11.5 pounds alone, will require extra shipping. Includes a biography of Turner and an impressive array of his works. #122 of 350 copies on Japanese paper. Sir Walter Armstrong was Director of the National Gallery of Ireland. Includes lists of Turner's oil paintings and his "watercolor drawings" as well as an index. Dimensions are as follows: 16.25 inches in spine length, nearly 12 inches in width, and 2.25 inches thick. VG-, Ex-Library, numbering on spine, pencil markings inside both covers, library label on front paste-down endpaper. Spine tight. Cover shows some wear, minor fraying to spine edges and hinges, age-darkenening to text block and outer edges of pages.
